explanation: In this context, disaster refers to a catastrophic event. In another context, disaster may refer to a very bad situation or outcome.
first_new_sentence: The earthquake caused a disaster in the city, destroying countless buildings and infrastructure.
second_new_sentence: The party turned into a disaster when the rain started pouring heavily and everyone had to leave early.

explanation: In this context, current refers to the flow of electricity. In another context, current may refer to something that is happening now.
first_new_sentence: The electrician checked the current flowing through the wires to ensure safety.
second_new_sentence: The current news highlights the ongoing issues with climate change and global warming.

explanation: In this context, nun refers to a member of a religious community. In another context, nun can refer to the word none, meaning not any.
first_new_sentence: The nun dedicated her life to helping those in need in the community.
second_new_sentence: I have a feeling that none of the participants will show up for the meeting.

sentence: These entries meet the specified criteria with words that have different meanings in the context of the jokes.
